title: Looking for a rounded tech sans similar to the Springloops logo
content:
Hello everybody,  
I know this is custom but I think there is a starting font (I think not rounded). The "s" is very specific, looks like DIN one...

[springloops logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.springloops.com/img/register/logo.gif)

Many thanks.
author: Ryuk

comments.content: The closest thing to a rounded DIN (until FF DIN Rounded is released) is [Chevin](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=chevin).
Many thanks Stephen. It is very close but the "s" of course doesn't match... I think it is more something from T26 Foundry or Identikal...

Thanks. I think it is more something like [Identikal Monark](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/Monark) but manually rounded... But the "s" doesn't match...  
There's also [T26 Utopy](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/Utopy) but not rounded and the "s" is totally off...  
The "s" looks like it comes from [Platelet](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/platelet/)... but not exactly...

My candidates for something that resembles it overall are [Euron](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/australiantype/euron/), [Reflex](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/reflex/) and [Leger](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824062814/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/leger/). The oblong counters, curved l, and strange 'g' were getting my attention more than the s.

- Mike Yanega
